question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Evaluate the product \[(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(-\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5-\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6-\sqrt7).\]
inference:
Let the expression be $P$.
$$ P=(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(-\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5-\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6-\sqrt7).$$
We can pair the factors:
$$(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(-\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7) = ((\sqrt6+\sqrt7)^2 - (\sqrt5)^2) = (6+7+2\sqrt{42}-5) = 8+2\sqrt{42}.$$
$$(\sqrt 5-\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6-\sqrt7) = ((\sqrt5)^2 - (\sqrt6-\sqrt7)(\sqrt6+\sqrt7)) = (5 - (6-7)) = (5 - (-1)) = 6.$$
So
$$ P = (8+2\sqrt{42})(6) = 48+12\sqrt{42}.$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{48+12\sqrt{42}}$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Using the difference-of-squares factorization repeatedly, we have \[\begin{aligned} &(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(-\sqrt 5+\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5-\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6-\sqrt7) \\ &= \left((\sqrt6+\sqrt7)^2 - (\sqrt5)^2\right)\left((\sqrt5)^2-(\sqrt6-\sqrt7)^2\right) \\ &= \left((13+2\sqrt{42})-5\right)\left(5-(13-2\sqrt{42})\right) \\ &= \left(2\sqrt{42}-8\right)\left(2\sqrt{42}+8\right) \\ &= (2\sqrt{42})^2 - 8^2 \\ &= 168- 64 \\&= \boxed{104}. \end{aligned}\]

$$(\sqrt 5-\sqrt6+\sqrt7)(\sqrt 5+\sqrt6-\sqrt7) = ((\sqrt5)^2 - (\sqrt6-\sqrt7)(\sqrt6+\sqrt7)) = (5 - (6-7)) = (5 - (-1)) = 6.$$
So
